description: Returns a list of Batch jobs. You must specify only one of the following items: You can filter the results by job status with the jobStatus parameter. If you don't specify a status, only RUNNING jobs are returned.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned by ListJobs in a paginated output. When this parameter is used, ListJobs returns up to maxResults results in a single page and a nextToken response element, if applicable. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another ListJobs request with the returned nextToken value. The following outlines key parameters and limitations: The minimum value is 1. When --job-status is used, Batch returns up to 1000 values. When --filters is used, Batch returns up to 100 values. If neither parameter is used, then ListJobs returns up to 1000 results (jobs that are in the RUNNING status) and a nextToken value, if applicable.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListJobs request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: The filter to apply to the query. Only one filter can be used at a time. When the filter is used, jobStatus is ignored. The filter doesn't apply to child jobs in an array or multi-node parallel (MNP) jobs. The results are sorted by the createdAt field, with the most recent jobs being first. JOB_NAME The value of the filter is a case-insensitive match for the job name. If the value ends with an asterisk (*), the filter matches any job name that begins with the string before the --*'. This corresponds to the jobName value. For example, test1 matches both Test1 and test1, and test1* matches both test1 and Test10. When the JOB_NAME filter is used, the results are grouped by the job name and version. JOB_DEFINITION The value for the filter is the name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job definition. This corresponds to the jobDefinition value. The value is case sensitive. When the value for the filter is the job definition name, the results include all the jobs that used any revision of that job definition name. If the value ends with an asterisk (*), the filter matches any job definition name that begins with the string before the --*'. For example, jd1 matches only jd1, and jd1* matches both jd1 and jd1A. The version of the job definition that's used doesn't affect the sort order. When the JOB_DEFINITION filter is used and the ARN is used (which is in the form arn:${Partition}:batch:${Region}:${Account}:job-definition/${JobDefinitionName}:${Revision}), the results include jobs that used the specified revision of the job definition. Asterisk (*) isn't supported when the ARN is used. BEFORE_CREATED_AT The value for the filter is the time that's before the job was created. This corresponds to the createdAt value. The value is a string representation of the number of milliseconds since 00:00:00 UTC (midnight) on January 1, 1970. AFTER_CREATED_AT The value for the filter is the time that's after the job was created. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that's used to return a more specific list of results from a ListJobs or ListJobsByConsumableResource API operation. name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case sensitive. values (list) --- The filter values. (string) ---

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the filter. Filter names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: jobSummaryList
nested_items.description: A list of job summaries that match the request.

nested_items.name: jobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job.

nested_items.name: jobId
nested_items.description: The job ID.

nested_items.name: jobName
nested_items.description: The job name.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp (in milliseconds) for when the job was created. For non-array jobs and parent array jobs, this is when the job entered the SUBMITTED state (at the time SubmitJob was called). For array child jobs, this is when the child job was spawned by its parent and entered the PENDING state.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status for the job.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: A short, human-readable string to provide more details for the current status of the job.

nested_items.name: startedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp for when the job was started. More specifically, it's when the job transitioned from the STARTING state to the RUNNING state.

nested_items.name: stoppedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp for when the job was stopped. More specifically, it's when the job transitioned from the RUNNING state to a terminal state, such as SUCCEEDED or FAILED.

nested_items.name: container
nested_items.description: An object that represents the details of the container that's associated with the job.

nested_items.name: exitCode
nested_items.description: The exit code to return upon completion.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: A short (255 max characters) human-readable string to provide additional details for a running or stopped container.

nested_items.name: arrayProperties
nested_items.description: The array properties of the job, if it's an array job.

nested_items.name: size
nested_items.description: The size of the array job. This parameter is returned for parent array jobs.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: The job index within the array that's associated with this job. This parameter is returned for children of array jobs.

nested_items.name: nodeProperties
nested_items.description: The node properties for a single node in a job summary list.

nested_items.name: isMainNode
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the current node is the main node for a multi-node parallel job.

nested_items.name: numNodes
nested_items.description: The number of nodes that are associated with a multi-node parallel job.

nested_items.name: nodeIndex
nested_items.description: The node index for the node. Node index numbering begins at zero. This index is also available on the node with the AWS_BATCH_JOB_NODE_INDEX environment variable.

nested_items.name: jobDefinition
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job definition.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The nextToken value to include in a future ListJobs request. When the results of a ListJobs request exceed maxResults, this value can be used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
